reporting-org.narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)

description.narrative: The overall goal is to improve health and hygiene situation of the people of Luang Prabang and Sayabouli provinces, especially the health of vulnerable groups such as women, children and ethnic groups. The specific objective of the water and sanitation component is “to improve the clean water supply and sanitation practices in villages and health facilities”. The project will contribute to achieving MDG 7 (sustainable access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation) targets in health, water and sanitation, in 14 districts of Sayaboury and Luang Prabang Provinces. Primary expected project outcome : as a result of the project intervention funded by SDC, 30,000 people (mostly from Khmu, Loa and Hmong ethnicity) in 60 villages in selected districts of Sayaboury and Luang Prabang Provinces will have access to safe drinking water, improved latrines and better health outcomes from the consolidated effect of improved hygiene. Expected SDC funded project results (1) 30’000 people in 60 villages have access to safe drinking water; (2) 6’000 households have access to well functioning household latrines; (3) 60 villages water committees maintain systems through village level financing mechanisms; (4) 60 village schools have water and sanitation facilities.
